title: Looking for similarities...
content:
Hi Folks,

I have a feeling that some of these logo designs may have appeared elsewhere.

Does anyone recognize any of them, or can you think of any existing logos that may look/feel similar?

Many thanks,  
Byron

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dp-logos.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/typophile.com/files/dp-logos.jpg) | 92.2 KB |

 [‹ Logo for Advertising, PR Agency](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44930 "Go to previous forum topic") [Designing in The Corporate Environment ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44800 "Go to next forum topic")
author: byronwrites

comments.content:
Top row, 3rd from left reminds me of Quark  
3rd row, 2nd from left reminds me (remotely) of Windows.  
Bottom row, 2nd from left reminds me of a feritility clinic which I can’t place.

Several do vaguely remind me of different things, but nothing specific. Why do you ask?

You might look around on [Logopond](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/logopond.com/) as well.

they all have the same name

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

Top to bottom, left to right:  
1 - Agricultural logo I saw about 10 years ago in Mexico  
2 - It looks too much like a stock icon  
3 - No comment  
4 - It looks too much like a stock icon  
5, 6, 7 - No comment  
8 - Similar to a TV show from Germany (check out dw-world.de)  
9 - ?  
10 - Too similar to a four-color press ad in CMYK magazine (or HOW or one of those)  
11 - No comment  
12 - There’s an antivirus software company who has a very similar brand  
13 - Typophile?

Why did you ask the question?

- Manuel

I was just trying to help out. The folks at DataPortability.org were trying to vet their logo candidates in order to avoid a potential case of trademark infringement.

Unfortunately, that’s precisely what happened. The logo that was selected (#3, 1st row) looks a bit too much like the Zaoza logo. It’s really too bad: [http://zaoza.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012142114/http:/zaoza.com/ "http://zaoza.com/")

They are probably going to look at a secondary candidates from this list, so if anyone has any other specific ideas about possible trademark infringements, any help would be great.

Thanks!
